timeline.bodyText: Would it be possible to also use ApiResponse in async operations to make it consistent?
timeline.author: wing328

replies.bodyText: @wing328 This ApiResponse is used by WithHttpInfo method which is implemented for sync operation only. Currently async operation doesn't need ApiResponse. I can include ApiResponse in async for future use, does anyone need WithHttpInfo method  for async operation?
replies.author: bgong-mdsol

replies.bodyText:
does anyone need WithHttpInfo method for async operation?

For consistency, I suggest we implement it as well if it's not a lot of work (we're implemented the same in other client generators)
replies.author: wing328

replies.bodyText:
My concern is, do we know whether people are actually using it? I'd hate we spend time on this when we might have a case of YAGNI.
If it is indeed needed, would it be ok to do that in a separate PR to facilitate the scheduling of work?
replies.author: jfeltesse-mdsol

replies.bodyText:
Valid concern. That's why I asked if it's a lot of work.
Feel free to do it later with another PR instead.
replies.author: wing328

replies.bodyText: And one more thing to add is that usually the sync operations in other clients simply call the async version of the operation and wait for completion.
replies.author: wing328
